document_name: General Policies on Energy decreed by the Supreme Leader
document_url: https://cdn.climatepolicyradar.org/IRN/2001/IRN-2001-01-22-General Policies on Energy decreed by the Supreme Leader_0699fb963fb615aeccd027478bc55c5d.pdf
document_description: The General Policies on Energy called for an increase in gas production capacity, according to the country's reserves, to meet domestic consumption and maximum replacement of petroleum products. It also required: optimum consumption and reduced energy intensity; diversification of the country's energy resources, with efforts to increase the share of renewables energies, primarily hydropower; to acquire the technical knowledge of renewable energy technologies such as wind and solar and fuel cells, and power and geothermal in the country.
